subject: JUnit & Log4J errors: Help
msgSnippet: JUnit 3.7 log4unit-0.1.2 Log4J 1.2.5 Ant 1.4.1 JDK 1.3.1_04 I am trying to enable logging/tracing statements in my source code that is under test.  If I run my
messageBody:
JUnit 3.7
log4unit-0.1.2
Log4J 1.2.5
Ant 1.4.1
JDK 1.3.1_04

I am trying to enable logging/tracing statements in my source code that is under test. If I run my application the log4j swing UI is displayed and all the log/trace statements are displayed. However I have now tried to integrate with JUnit by using log4unit. I am starting my ant tests like this: -

<target name="runtests" depends="compiletests" if="junit.present">
<java fork="yes" classname="junit.logswingui.TestRunner"
taskname="junit" failonerror="true">
<arg value="test.com.hp.ov.slm.ui.sched.AllJUnitTests"/>
<classpath>
<pathelement location="build/lib/${app.name}.jar" />
<pathelement location="build/lib/junit.jar" />
<pathelement location="build/lib/log4j-1.2.5.jar" />
<pathelement location="build/lib/log4unit-0.1.2.jar" />
<pathelement location="build/testcases" />
<pathelement path="${java.class.path}" />
<pathelement path="" />
</classpath>
</java>
</target>

I get the following errors: -

log4j: ERROR A 'org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender" object is not assignable to a "org.apache.log4j.Appender variable.
log4j: ERROR Could not instatiate appender named "console"

This error happens for RollingFileAppender and JUnitAppender

Does anyone have an example on how this is done, and why I am getting these errors.

Thank you
